sense.name: STAY AT, STAY OVER--reside temporarily
sense.examples: We're staying at the Hilton. I recently stayed at the ETAP Hotel on Colmore Steet, Birmingham. The boy's friends were allowed to stay over after the birthday party. It's so late, why don't you just stay over?

sense.name: STAY AWAY--avoid
sense.examples: Stay away from that man, he is dangerous!

sense.name: STAY FRESH--keep from spoiling
sense.examples: Rolled sandwiches will stay fresh until lunch time. Once opened, soy milk will stay fresh for seven to 10 days if kept refrigerated.

sense.name: STAY IN PLACE, STAY PUT--be stationary
sense.examples: It seems like women are running faster just to stay in place. He would have survived if his helmet had stayed in place. The remainder of the Jell-O stabilized and stayed put on the nails quite securely.

sense.name: STAY OFF--refrain from entering or walking on
sense.examples: Stay off the grass. He warned us to stay off his property.

sense.name: STAY ON--continue in a position or situation
sense.examples: After graduation, she stayed on in Cambridge as a student adviser. Aa hardline Islamic alliance yesterday protested Musharraf's plan to stay on as army chief.

sense.name: STAY TOGETHER--remain in a relationship
sense.examples: Fountain District business owners have stayed together through tough times. We only stayed together for the kids.

sense.name: STAY UP--don't go to sleep
sense.examples: On Friday nights, we let the kids stay up until ten.
